item.title: Rugby fans furious over 2027 Rugby World Cup ticket website crashes
item.description: Rugby fans from around the world are furious after failing to get tickets to the 2027 Men's World Cup due technical glitches and website crashes.

item.title: Hanson digs her heels in, Taylor goes on tour
item.description: This week, the new opposition leader revealed his shadow cabinet while Pauline Hanson spun through a cycle she knows well.

item.title: Two WA childcare providers fined after high-needs children wander off from care
item.description: One of Australia's biggest providers of before-and-after-school care penalised after a five-year-old neurodivergent child escapes supervision unnoticed.

item.title: Long-awaited rapid bus plan fails to reveal construction timeline or routes
item.description: After about a year of delays, the Tasmanian government has released its strategic business case for the Greater Hobart Rapid Bus Network, but a lot of the detail has not been included.

item.title: Man accused of 'controlling' the lives of Venezuelan youth group granted bail
item.description: An alleged religious leader accused of "controlling every aspect" of the lives of a Venezuelan youth group has been granted release on strict home detention conditions by a South Australian court.

item.title: Collingwood apologises after asking elderly members for donations via their wills
item.description: The Magpies have come under fire after a letter campaign asking elderly members to amend their wills to donate to the AFL club.

item.title: Thursday finance with Daniel Ziffer
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Abandoned Antarctic base is now a pollution threat
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: Former prince returns home as police investigation continues — as it happened
item.description: Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor has returned to his Sandringham home after being arrested and questioned on suspicion of misconduct in public office.

item.title: What we know about ex-prince Andrew's arrest on suspicion of misconduct in public office
item.description: Police are searching two addresses in the UK, including Royal Lodge on the Windsor Estate where the former prince lived until last year.

item.title: Former premier joins community calls for speed reduction at 'dangerous' fatal intersection in Newham
item.description: A community in central Victoria is calling for a 20 kph speed limit reduction at a "terribly dangerous" intersection after four major accidents.

item.title: Sisters Lisa and Rachael Maza reunite on stage for the world premiere of Black Light
item.description: The former head of Indigenous theatre company Ilbijerri teams up with her sister Lisa for the world premiere of Black Light, which tells the story of three generations of Blak women.

item.title: Calls for protection of Tasmania's penguins amid reports of birds 'handled by the neck'
item.description: Each summer, tourists flock to Tasmanian beaches to marvel at penguins, but for some, admiring the birds from afar is not enough.

item.title: Police say 'hope is fading' in hunt for kidnapped Sydney grandfather
item.description: Police believe they have found a "stronghold" used by the kidnappers of Chris Baghsarian in Dural as the search for the 85-year-old continues.

item.title: As electric car prices fall, will affordability win over drivers?
item.description: The price tag of EVs has been a barrier to uptake. As cheaper models hit the market, will more drivers go electric?

item.title: Voters divided as Barnaby Joyce considers contesting New England for One Nation
item.description: One Nation MP Barnaby Joyce says he might recontest his seat of New England as a candidate for One Nation if the party needs him to.

item.title: Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor's arrest could end monarchy's 'never complain, never explain' mentality
item.description: British royals have lived by the adage "never complain, never explain", but these days, many of their subjects are demanding answers.

item.title: Youth justice experts warn over-policing of residential care children is 'manufacturing criminals'
item.description: Experts say over-policing and South Australia's youth criminal justice system is helping turn children in residential care into criminals.

item.title: Study to test whether a new helmet will significantly reduce risk of concussion in football players
item.description: A lot of research has gone in to treating concussions, but now scientists are testing a new helmet to see if it can prevent them before they happen.

item.title: More rainfall expected for parts of northern Queensland after wet week
item.description: A risk for further heavy rainfall and thunderstorms is possible in northern parts of the state today and into the weekend.

item.title: First NT women's prison opens in Alice Springs with focus on rehabilitation to break 'cycle of reoffending'
item.description: Thirty-five female prisoners have moved into the Northern Territory's first women's prison, near Alice Springs, with more expected in the coming months.

item.title: Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor released under investigation after almost 10 hours in custody
item.description: The former Duke of York has been released under investigation by British police, as officers continue to search his former Windsor home.

item.title: Bangarra Dance Theatre wins Golden Lion at international dance festival Venice Danza 2026
item.description: Indigenous dance company Bangarra Dance Theatre has become the first company and first First Nations performers to receive the Golden Lion at Venice Danza, the international festival of contemporary dance.

item.title: 'Dying' NASA satellite leaves Australia's north waiting hours for latest fire information
item.description: A NASA satellite used to detect bushfires in real time across two thirds of Australia is "dying" and it could be months before a replacement is online.

item.title: Canadian skier Cassie Sharpe's horrific crash in the halfpipe reminds us of Winter Olympics dangers
item.description: As Cassie Sharpe lay motionless on the base of the Livigno halfpipe, the excruciating tension reminded us all that winter Olympians are only ever seconds from disaster.

item.title: Fiji, Palau and Tuvalu set to show world leaders climate change impact ahead of COP31
item.description: Fiji, Palau and Tuvalu look set to host world leaders and climate change ministers in the lead-up to COP31 in a bid to encourage larger countries to accelerate cuts to emissions.

item.title: Is it OK to feed Australia's wild birds?
item.description: Many of us love interacting with and feeding wild birds, but experts say giving them the wrong types of food can do more harm than good.

item.title: Brisbane Broncos lose World Club Challenge to Hull KR 30-24
item.description: After pulling off three straight comebacks to win the NRL premiership, the Brisbane Broncos fall just short of another miracle against Hull KR in the World Club Challenge.

item.title: Eric Dane, star of Grey's Anatomy and Euphoria, dies aged 53
item.description: The star was best known for his role as Dr Mark Sloan in long-running medical drama Grey's Anatomy, and as the patriarch of the Jacobs family in teen hit Euphoria.

item.title: WA councils could make laws to stop cats roaming under proposed state legislation
item.description: The WA government announces plans to give local councils the power to require cats to be contained to owners' properties, to protect native birds and other wildlife.

item.title: Racist hate mail sent to politicians bears hallmarks of Lakemba Mosque letters
item.description: The ABC can reveal two of the threatening, hate-filled letters sent to Lakemba Mosque this month bear close resemblance to similar racist letters sent to multiple politicians since 2022.

item.title: Darwin prisoner Clinton Daylight found, returned to custody two days after being freed from jail by mistake
item.description: A 52-year-old inmate who was mistakenly released from the Darwin Correctional Centre two months before his sentence was due to end, due to an "administration error" by prison staff, has been found following a police search.

item.title: MotoGP Adelaide move raises concerns about rider safety, transport and trees
item.description: A rider, a reporter and a road safety expert say it will be difficult to make it safe for motorcycles to race around the Adelaide Parklands.

item.title: Port Pirie's toddlers record highest blood lead levels in a decade
item.description: The percentage of two-year-old children above the blood lead level threshold in Port Pirie is the highest in a decade, according to the latest figures.

item.title: Ellyse Perry's evolution cements greatness as Australian cricket milestone looms
item.description: Cricket superstar Ellyse Perry will become the first woman to play 350 matches for Australia across all formats on Saturday.

item.title: Queensland's new chief health officer Marianne Gale outlines future priorities
item.description: Marianne Gale reminisces about her time working for Doctors Without Borders to emphasise how she wants to shape the public health of the state – with a strong focus on equity.

item.title: New Zealand man Tamaohungia Joseph Tepatu-Edwards jailed for 26 years for attempted cocaine importation
item.description: A man who tried to smuggle more than 800 kilograms of cocaine into WA – and was only caught when his boat broke down — will spend two decades in jail and is "likely" be deported.

item.title: Rottnest Channel Swim cancelled due to strong winds, choppy seas
item.description: Perth's iconic Rottnest Channel Swim has been cancelled as forecast strong winds and unfavourable ocean conditions leaves thousands of swimmers and support crew disappointed.

item.title: Police receive 'reports of crime' in relation to Pauline Hanson interview
item.description: One Nation senator Pauline Hanson accuses the government of trying to put her "back in jail", after police received reports of a crime in relation to the senator's inflammatory comments about Muslims during a media interview.

item.title: NSW Waratahs defeat Fijian Drua in Super Rugby Pacific round two, Pete Samu plays after birth of child
item.description: Wallabies veteran Pete Samu has helped the NSW Waratahs to consecutive wins to start the Super Rugby Pacific season, just hours after the birth of his child.

item.title: Australia blows Oman away to end T20 World Cup campaign with a bang
item.description: Australia has flogged Oman, chasing down 105 in less than 10 overs to end a disappointing World Cup campaign on a high. Follow live.

item.title: Man whose girlfriend froze to death after he left her on mountain convicted of manslaughter
item.description: A man who left his girlfriend to freeze to death on an Austrian mountain has been handed a five-month suspended sentence for manslaughter.

item.title: Jeffrey Epstein's estate agrees to pay up to $US35 million to settle class action
item.description: Jeffrey Epstein's estate has agreed to pay as much as $US35 million to resolve a class action lawsuit, according to a court filing on Thursday.

item.title: UK government to consider removing Andrew from succession line, as royal protection police face grilling
item.description: The UK government is to look at removing Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor from the line of succession, an official says, as royal protection police face a grilling on "anything they saw or heard".

item.title: Should Labor do its own refresh after Angus Taylor's Liberal 'rebrand'?
item.description: In the past few days, in a series of largely ignored milestones overshadowed by news of Angus Taylor's new frontbench, Albanese overtook Scott Morrison and John Curtin to become the 12th-longest serving prime minister.

item.title: Andy Griffiths, author of the Treehouse books, named new Australian Children's Laureate
item.description: Famous for writing stories about toilets and tree houses, the bestselling kids' author is taking on a new challenge on the national stage.

item.title: Tell us what is going on in grassroots footy
item.description: Do you have a story about the culture at a footy netball club in your community? ABC Regional Investigations wants to hear from you.

item.title: The town that turned its back on a rape victim
item.description: A local footy star and his mate are convicted of raping their friend. In the tiny town of Balmoral, where the footy club reigns, the town makes it clear whose story they believe.

item.title: Heaviest outback rain in decades forecast to reach SA, NSW and Victorian farmers
item.description: The driest belt of Australia sees its wettest month in decades, and weather modelling tips the outback rain will reach southern Australia this weekend.

item.title: Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor's future uncertain under monarch willing to let 'the law take its course'
item.description: Like so many of the elite caught in Epstein's web, Andrew believed he would escape scrutiny for his behaviour. But it is precisely because of his name and position that his alleged wrongdoing has now delivered him into the hands of the law.

item.title: Why Pacific Islands are rapidly de-flagging Russia's fleet of 'shadow tankers'
item.description: Pacific Islands are rapidly de-flagging vessels on their shipping registries after gaining international attention for their role in Russia's "shadow fleet".

item.title: Nathan Cleary facing two-match suspension over high hit in Panthers' trial loss to Wests Tigers
item.description: Nathan Cleary can accept a two-match suspension with an early plea after his high hit on Wests Tigers star Heamasi Makasini.

item.title: The art and origins of the courtroom sketch
item.description: They're a small and curious cohort in a line of work rapidly evolving. Welcome to the world of courtroom artists.

item.title: Peter Malinauskas is heading for a landslide win in SA. How crushing a victory will it be?
item.description: Even if it's a Labor landslide, we'll learn a lot from next month's South Australian election, writes Casey Briggs.

item.title: Manchester United owner Jim Ratcliffe avoids sanctions after saying UK has been 'colonised' by immigrants
item.description: Jim Ratcliffe is reminded of his responsibilities as a participant in English football but is not handed any penalties from FA after his controversial call.

item.title: Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor's arrest shows money talks louder than women's testimony
item.description: Why is an email about the trade trip apparently more compelling than the detailed and painful evidence of a woman?

item.title: Man and 15yo boy charged over shooting of former NRL player Matt Utai
item.description: Police allege a 25-year-old man was responsible for the shooting of former NRL player Matt Utai, while a 15-year-old drove the getaway car.

item.title: Research sparks renewed calls for needle exchange programs to be introduced in Australian prisons
item.description: Researchers and advocates are calling for needle exchange programs to be introduced in prisons to help combat the risks of sharing needles and using unsafe devices to inject illicut drugs.

item.title: Community Emergency Response Team volunteer paramedics fill care gap
item.description: In parts of rural and remote New South Wales, groups of volunteers are brushing up on high-level first aid skills to become first responders when an ambulance crew cannot.

item.title: Farmer's hands-off approach creates unusual lamb with distinct flavour chefs say is like nothing else in Australia
item.description: When Frank was forced to sell the sheep he'd been farming for more than 20 years, something had to change. His "experiment" is helping expats feel at home.

item.title: After 60 years, there are fears Myer may walk away from Launceston's CBD
item.description: Community and business leaders say the possible departure of retailer Myer would leave a "giant hole" in the heart of the city's shopping district.

item.title: Queensland woman wakes from coma after contracting meningitis and septic shock on ski holiday to Japan
item.description: When 24-year-old Anna Gallo woke up shivering in a Tokyo hotel, she thought it was food poisoning. Hours later, she was in a coma fighting for her life against a disease she thought she was vaccinated against.

item.title: Cattle tick outbreak raises questions over Queensland's biosecurity
item.description: Queensland is known for its hardline biosecurity stance against foreign pests, but farmers say a recent cattle tick outbreak has exposed systemic weaknesses.

item.title: Bayern Munich coach Vincent Kompany says José Mourinho made 'huge mistake' attacking Vinícius Júnior's character after alleged racist insult
item.description: Bayern Munich manager Vincent Kompany dissects the racism row involving Real Madrid and Brazil star Viní Jr with a passionate 12-minute speech.

item.title: Herby potato salad with green beans and tuna - ABC News
item.description: Turn a potato salad into a tasty meal with pantry staples and fresh greens.

item.title: Why economists hate low unemployment for inflation
item.description: The theory goes that if you have just the right amount of workers on the unemployment scrap heap, you can keep inflation in check. The problem is that no-one knows exactly what the magic unemployment rate is.

item.title: Potential release of carp control virus into waterways delayed until 2028
item.description: Release of a virus to control carp in Australian waterways has been delayed until 2028, a decade after it was initially slated for release.

item.title: How Reuters captured that photo of former Prince Andrew leaving custody
item.description: The image, taken by Reuters photographer Phil Noble, went viral when it was published on Thursday. He says capturing the moment came down to a tip-off and more than a little luck.

item.title: I had a miscarriage over the summer. It was nothing like I expected
item.description: My understanding of miscarriage was built on a handful of Hollywood representations and snatches of stories I'd read. Outside of this, I had few reference points.

item.title: Adam Zampa says claims Australia does not care about T20 cricket 'totally false' after World Cup flop
item.description: Adam Zampa hits back at claims that Australia does not care about T20 cricket after a disappointing World Cup campaign.

item.title: The shamans and designer handbags before Yoon Suk Yeol's insurrection conviction
item.description: Former South Korean president Yoon Suk Yeol's sentence for insurrection comes after a tumultuous era of shamanism, Chanel bags and conspiracy theories.

item.title: How a Belgian techno producer with some old synthesisers has reimagined Terminator 2
item.description: Terminator 2: Judgment Day is getting the live score treatment, but not in the way you might expect.

item.title: Viral AI videos raise questions about how we view reality
item.description: For a bit of a laugh, Travis Marshall uses artificial intelligence to create wacky videos about his hometown, but his light-hearted content also raises serious questions about reality in the age of AI.

item.title: Drugs with estimated street value of $1.45 million seized in traffic stop
item.description: A traffic stop on the Pacific Highway on the NSW Mid North Coast has led to the seizure of hundreds of thousands of dollars' worth of cocaine and cannabis, police say.

item.title: Farmer builds chapel for Tongan workers, the 'backbone' of her banana farm
item.description: A Queensland banana farmer spent 10 years saving to build a chapel for the Tongan workers who form the backbone of her family’s operation on Cape York Peninsula.

item.title: The US Supreme Court's take-down of Trump's tariffs explained
item.description: The ruling on tariffs is a hugely consequential decision that has infuriated the president, who is now looking for workarounds.

item.title: Punch the baby macaque draws a crowd at Japan's Ichikawa City Zoo
item.description: The six month old macaque's relationship with a soft toy orangutan has become an internet sensation.

item.title: Man charged after allegedly throwing 'lit incendiary device' during Navy chief's speech
item.description: A man faces court accused of throwing a fake explosive device through a Canberra hotel window during a speech from the Chief of Navy.

item.title: Auckland FC defeat Wellington Phoenix 5-0 in A-League Men, goalkeeper Josh Oluwayemi own goal begins rout
item.description: Wellington Phoenix goalkeeper Josh Oluwayemi commits one of the worst howlers this A-League Men season, heading a clearance kick into his own net as Auckland FC romps to a big win.

item.title: South Australian election countdown officially begins, campaign kicks off
item.description: Election campaigning in South Australia is officially underway, with candidates seizing the opportunity to begin making their formal pitches to voters before they head to the ballot box in March.

item.title: Hungary and Slovakia threaten Ukraine over stalled Russian oil shipments
item.description: Hungary and Slovakia, which have both received a temporary exemption from an EU policy prohibiting imports of Russian oil, have accused Ukraine of deliberately holding up supplies.

item.title: Albanese government bears inflation pressure while premiers spend big, poll well
item.description: High-spending premiers remain popular and seemingly impervious to the rising cost-of-living anxiety piling pressure on the Albanese government.

item.title: Hard Quiz: Think you're a trivia boss? Show us what you've got
item.description: Well, this is cute — you thinking you're a quiz pro. It's time to play … HARD!

item.title: Bridgerton's Yerin Ha is living her own Cinderella story
item.description: Yerin Ha built a name for herself in local and international productions for almost a decade before transforming into Bridgerton's newest paramour.

item.title: On the front lines of Australia's fight against vaccine hesitancy
item.description: With immunisation rates declining and outbreaks of infectious diseases like measles increasing, the consequences of vaccine hesitancy in Australia are becoming clearer.

item.title: More assault allegations surface against footballers in tiny town of Balmoral
item.description: More women come forward with allegations of sexual assault in a small Victorian town, years after a rape victim was shunned by the town.

item.title: Donald Trump hikes global tariff rate to 15pc after Supreme Court loss
item.description: Donald Trump says he will raise to 15 per cent the global tariff he imposed after the US Supreme Court ruled against previous tariffs.

item.title: Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor was the Queen's rumoured favourite. Did she do too much to protect him?
item.description: It will be up to King Charles to shepherd his family's institution through its darkest hour. But could his own mother have done more to snuff out this crisis before he inherited it?

item.title: A visual guide to the prices that landed Coles in court
item.description: The pricing patterns of these six products show how Coles stands accused of using its Down Down marketing campaign to dupe shoppers.

item.title: Coastal communities weigh costs and potential retreat as erosion batters SA's Limestone Coast
item.description: With costs and damage mounting, councils are considering all options, including pulling back from the beaches.

item.title: India claims series win over Australia in Ellyse Perry's historic 350th international match
item.description: There is no fairytale for Ellyse Perry in her 350th international match as Smriti Mandhana stars to lead India to a series win over Australia.

item.title: SA Labor mulls One Nation's rise as Liberals fight for campaign oxygen
item.description: In the final week before the election writs were issued, the SA Premier trained his sights on One Nation while the Liberals fought for oxygen. Is it a sign of the campaign ahead?

item.title: Patients three times more likely to escape from Cumberland Hospital, data shows
item.description: Cumberland Hospital is under investigation after two patients who escaped from its care within 24 hours allegedly caused three people's deaths.

item.title: Daly Cherry-Evans and Sam Walker show promising signs as Eels down Roosters in NRL trial
item.description: Daly Cherry-Evans shows immediate signs of a strong combination with new Roosters halves mate Sam Walker in his first match for his new NRL club.

item.title: After 20 years as the only town listed on the NSW State Heritage Registry, Braidwood is at a turning point
item.description: A walk along the main street of this town is stepping in the footsteps of bushrangers, movie stars, artists and migrants.

item.title: Farmers on tenterhooks as trade deal with the European Union edges closer
item.description: Australia is on the cusp of signing a landmark free trade deal with the EU, but will it come at a cost?

item.title: Johannes Høsflot Klæbo becomes first athlete to win six gold medals at one Winter Olympics
item.description: Johannes Høsflot Klæbo adds to his legacy as the greatest Winter Olympian of all-time by winning his sixth gold of these Olympics and 11th overall.

item.title: Lighthouse keepers' cottages on Pine Islet to be demolished by reef authority
item.description: The remnants of a lighthouse station close to 100 years old on an island off the Mackay coast are set to be dismantled due to asbestos concerns, sparking fears important history will be lost.

item.title: Massive goat trap in remote WA merges new technology and old ideas
item.description: When their station's fragile landscape needed protection from feral goats, Calum and Belinda Carruth seized on an idea that has become marvel of technology and pest management.

item.title: Punk's boom began 50 years ago in Brisbane — and the scene is still thriving
item.description: The Saints released their single "(I'm) Stranded" in 1976, kicking off the punk movement in Australia. So how did it all unfold?

item.title: Miner MMG puts forward alternative Rosebery tailings dam site in Exe Valley
item.description: Global mining company MMG has long been seeking to build a third tailings storage dam at its mine on the Tasmanian west coast, in the face of strong opposition from environmentalists. It's now put forward an alternative which conservationists say they won't fight.

item.title: UK passport changes leave Australians with dual citizenship scrambling before border rules kick in
item.description: There's been a last-minute scramble for some Australians with dual British or Irish citizenship, as new UK border rules come into force within days.

item.title: What is the bare minimum when it comes to packing kids' lunch boxes?
item.description: This is the bare minimum you should aim for to cover the nutritional basics for your children's school lunches.

item.title: Rap program aims to reduce reoffending among young people in custody
item.description: The musical genre is helping young offenders at a juvenile detention centre in southern NSW find their voices.

item.title: Child psychiatrist Benjamin Wen indecently touched boys while doing 'puberty checks', court told
item.description: A former child psychiatrist who changed his name after being convicted of child exploitation touched young neurodivergent boys indecently at his practice, a Perth court hears. WARNING: This story contains details that may distress some readers.

item.title: Eating disorder clinic to open near Mandurah as frustration grows over residential facility
item.description: As an eating disorder clinic prepares to open its doors near Mandurah south of Perth, a residential eating disorder clinic is still in the planning stages despite being on the cards for years.

item.title: Minister reveals process has started to ban Hizb ut-Tahrir under new hate laws
item.description: Tony Burke has also provided an update on the cohort of 34 Australians seeking to leave a Syrian refugee camp.

item.title: Alisa Camplin-Warner calls for more funding after historic 2026 Milano Cortina Winter Olympics
item.description: Australia's chef de mission Alisa Camplin-Warner says the successful team deserve more funding for future Games.

item.title: What the Bad Bunny in Australia tour means for Puerto Ricans far from home
item.description: This weekend Bad Bunny offers Australia a lesson in community, identity and how to belong without diluting your true self.

item.title: Great-grandmother's garlic mushroom artwork puts new spin on managing food waste
item.description: Meet the country artist putting a slightly unexpected spin on garlic mushrooms.

item.title: After a rare Supreme Court loss for Trump, here's his record with the bench
item.description: Donald Trump was furious when the US Supreme Court ruled that his use of tariffs was illegal. Here's how earlier cases in that jurisdiction have fared.

item.title: Hundreds of 'toxic' poppies stolen from Victorian farm triggers health department alert
item.description: About 1,700 poppy plants grown for the pharmaceutical industry have been stolen from a regional property north-west of Melbourne, prompting a warning from the state health department.

item.title: Labor launches SA election campaign with land and housing promises
item.description: SA Labor's state election campaign launch is framed around housing, with the premier committing to a scheme for the purchase of land that would then be on-sold to the private sector for development.

item.title: How construction corruption is affecting housing affordability
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Nathan Cleary to risk missing first three Panthers games by challenging ban at NRL judiciary
item.description: Nathan Cleary will either be available to play Brisbane in round one or will miss the opening three rounds after Penrith decided to challenge his high tackle ban.

item.title: East West rail corridor cut by flooding amid heavy rain in northern SA
item.description: The cross-country rail line connecting Australia's east and west has been closed after heavy rain and flash flooding washed away significant sections of track, the corridor's manager says.

item.title: USA beats Canada in overtime to end 46-year gold medal drought
item.description: Team USA beats Canada 2-1 in overtime to win the country's first men's ice hockey gold medal since 1980 in the last event of the 2026 Milano Cortina Winter Olympic Games, after Australian 16-year-old Indra Brown finishes fifth in the freeski halfpipe final.

item.title: Coalition calls to criminalise assistance to ISIS-linked Australians seeking to return
item.description: The federal opposition proposes a new criminal offence to punish those who help Australians with links to Islamic State to return home, accusing the government of being complacent about the possible return of 34 wives and children of former fighters.

item.title: Indra Brown's phenomenal fifth in freeski halfpipe at 2026 Milano Cortina Winter Olympics a sign of her rapid rise
item.description: Four months ago, Indra Brown had not even competed in a senior World Cup event. Her fifth-placed finish in her maiden Winter Olympics proves her meteoric rise is no fluke.

item.title: US Secret Service agents shoot dead armed man entering Donald Trump's Mar-a-Lago resort
item.description: United States Secret Service agents shoot dead a man carrying a shotgun and a fuel can after he breaches the secure perimeter at Mar-a-Lago.

item.title: Australian Antarctic Program relies on ice runway at Wilkins Aerodrome
item.description: The ice runway at Wilkins Aerodrome is a critical asset in the Australian Antarctic Program, but getting it ready for flights is nothing short of extreme.

item.title: Micro-interventions to reduce stress in your day
item.description: Experts say we don't need to overhaul our lives to reduce our stress effectively. Here are some tips you can use right now.

item.title: 'Fearless, full of passion': Winter Games end with stunning ceremony
item.description: The Milano Cortina Games are farewelled in style as the closing ceremony brings the 2026 Winter Olympics to an end.

item.title: Simon Gordon's endometriosis surgeries were gynaecology's open secret. Now colleagues and patients are speaking out
item.description: Complaints had been made about this gynaecologist for years. Only when hospital management discovered that Four Corners was looking into his practice, did it start investigating further.

item.title: Albanese changes tune on immigration and 'ISIS brides' as One Nation effect hits
item.description: A lot has been written about One Nation cannibalising the Coalition's vote, but less attention has been given to how the rise of the once-fringe party is also activating Labor.

item.title: Energy watchdog to force retailers to offer struggling customers help in overhaul
item.description: Amid soaring prices and rising levels of energy hardship, the regulator wants to strengthen the protections for vulnerable customers.

item.title: Reducing inequality means taxing capital more — including inheritances
item.description: Intergenerational inequality will only be dealt with by taxing the people that have the money, not by cutting the taxes of those who don't have it.

item.title: Home owners struggle as insurance premiums rise more than 50 per cent in five years
item.description: Home insurance premiums continue to rise, with properties in natural disaster-prone areas paying the most.

item.title: Three-year wait for national criminal history checker makes parents 'sick'
item.description: A key government commitment to protect children from sexual predators will not be "fully functional" for at least three years.

item.title: Arab and Muslim nations condemn Mike Huckabee's suggestion Israel could claim biblical right to territory
item.description: Mike Huckabee suggests Israel could claim a biblical right to territory far beyond its borders in the Middle East.

item.title: Marshall Islands launches first universal basic income scheme to stop outward migration
item.description: Citizens of the Marshall Islands will receive "free money" as the government launches a world-first universal basic income scheme.

item.title: Andrew's arrest leaves questions for Sarah Ferguson but daughters could be protected
item.description: Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor's arrest has cast another long shadow over the York family. While his ex-wife, Sarah Ferguson, has vanished from public view, their daughters Beatrice and Eugenie face an uncertain future.

item.title: Film about new mother wins as Tropfest returns to Sydney with crowd of 35,000
item.description: Out of more than 700 entries, only 16 shorts made the premiere, but it was Sydney mum Lianne Mackessy who won the $50,000 award.

item.title: School, university blindsided by child abuse allegations against teacher and academic Michael James Carty
item.description: A Victorian teacher and casual academic has resigned after being charged with possessing and distributing child abuse material.

item.title: From OKCupid to community wedding: Jackie and Aimee's love story
item.description: Neither Jackie nor Aimee wanted something serious when they met, but a COVID-19 lockdown helped them take the plunge. Now they're married, and had to tackle the "in sickness and health" part of their vows sooner than they expected.

item.title: Queensland real estate agents prepare for Anzac Day trading shutdown
item.description: With Anzac Day falling on a Saturday this year, trading restrictions mean open houses and auctions will need to be rescheduled.

item.title: Eight rescued from floodwater as severe weather warning continues for western Queensland
item.description: A tropical low is sitting over the south-eastern part of the Northern Territory, bringing the risk of heavy rainfall to parts of western Queensland that are already flooding.

item.title: ASX slides, gold jumps and bitcoin slumps as Trump's new regime hits — as it happened
item.description: The ASX lost ground across the session as concerns about the new tariff regime hit home and disappointing results were punished.

item.title: South Africa defeats India in T20 World Cup Super Eight by 76 runs
item.description: South Africa bulldozed defending champions India by 76 runs in their Super Eight group one clash in the T20 World Cup, underlining their title credentials and sending a strong signal to their rivals.

item.title: Kurdish official casts doubt on how quickly IS-linked Australians could try to return home again
item.description: A Kurdish official says the Australian government's criticism of the group that attempted to return to Australia will frustrate the process of them trying to return again.

item.title: BAFTAs Film winners: Robert Aramayo wins best leading actor, Aussies miss out
item.description: British actor Robert Aramayo has beaten frontrunners Timothée Chalamet and Leonardo DiCaprio to take the leading actor BAFTA.

item.title: Mount Gambier man given three months to live documents battle with rare lymphoma
item.description: Mount Gambier man Ben Whitehead's world changed when he was diagnosed with lymphoma and initially given three months to live, but he's doing his best to stay positive.

item.title: Nauiyu / Daly River flood evacuees assess damage after returning home
item.description: Flood evacuees from the remote community of Nauiyu / Daly River have returned to their homes to survey the damage after two weeks hunkered down in Darwin.

item.title: Matildas Sam Kerr and Mary Fowler receive boost before Asian Cup
item.description: Australia's two superstar Matildas will fly home for the Women's Asian Cup in buoyant mood after Mary Fowler made her first start in 315 days and Sam Kerr proved once again she's the queen of the FA Cup with a smartly taken goal.

item.title: Michael Rowland to leave ABC after 39 years in front of camera
item.description: After almost four decades in front of the camera, former News Breakfast host Michael Rowland announces he is leaving the ABC.

item.title: Australia's golden 2026 Winter Olympic Games could just be the latest step towards sustained glory
item.description: Australia's medal-filled 2026 Winter Olympics campaign will live long in the memory. Not as the peak of this sunburned nation's snowy achievements, though. Just the beginning.

item.title: Disposable cameras in focus for Perth photography project
item.description: A unique community exhibition in Perth is celebrating the "messiness and spontaneity" of the disposable camera.

item.title: Winter Olympics 2026: Eileen Gu reveals grief after gold medal, closing ceremony ends Games — quick hits from the final day
item.description: Chinese superstar Eileen Gu claimed gold while nursing the pain of loss, as Sweden's curling "circus" team triumphed. Here are the quick hits from the final day of the Milano Cortina Games.

item.title: 'Tough road ahead' for Burleigh Bears player Jacek McLaurin hospitalised by tackle
item.description: Burleigh Bears outside back Jacek McLaurin was rushed to Princess Alexandra Hospital in Brisbane on Saturday and remains in a critical condition.

item.title: For the Olympics to remain relevant, it is essential it embraces sustainability
item.description: Olympic Games chief executive Christophe Dubi tells ABC Sport that in order for the Olympics to remain relevant, it simply has to embrace sustainable practices.

item.title: Taliban vows retaliation after Pakistan claims to have killed at least 70 in air strikes
item.description: Pakistan's military claims to have killed at least 70 militants in air strikes against neighbouring Afghanistan, but the Taliban in Afghanistan says this is false.

item.title: Mexican army kills 'El Mencho', leader of powerful Jalisco New Generation cartel
item.description: Powerful Mexican drug lord Nemesio Oseguera Cervantes, known as "El Mencho", is killed in a military raid, sparking a wave of unrest and violence in several Mexican states.

item.title: Police scour bushland for kidnapped Sydney man Chris Baghsarian
item.description: Police officers are scouring dense bushland in Sydney's north-west for the missing 85-year-old grandfather, following a police operation overnight.

item.title: Adam Scott finishes fourth in US PGA Tour event at Riviera Golf Course
item.description: Adam Scott produces a terrific final round to finish fourth in the US PGA Tour event at Riviera Golf Course.

item.title: Arson attacks in Mexico after 'El Mencho' killed by military
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: US and Iran to meet for third round of nuclear talks in Geneva
item.description: The third round of talks between the US and Iran comes amid growing tensions between the long-time adversaries.

item.title: Pole vaulter Kurtis Marschall becomes the fourth Australian to clear 6 metres in pole vault
item.description: Pole vaulter Kurtis Marschall becomes the fourth Australian to clear 6 metres, achieving the landmark feat at an indoor meet in France.

item.title: Scone breaks daily rainfall record in 2 hours but farmers say more is needed to rid region of drought
item.description: A NSW town in the grips of a dry spell breaks its daily rainfall record, but farmers say much more rain is needed to save the season.

item.title: ACT Brumbies keeping cool after historic win over Crusaders in Christchurch
item.description: ACT Brumbies coach Stephen Larkham has said his team "won't get ahead of ourselves" after producing a stunning win over the Crusaders in Christchurch.

item.title: Younger people reflect on untapped 'wealth of knowledge' in intergenerational friendships
item.description: Headlines often highlight the divisions between older and younger Australians, but research suggests intergenerational friendships can help to reduce age-based discrimination in both directions, while offering other benefits.

item.title: Heavy rain soaks the Barkly and Central Australia, closing roads and inundating cattle stations
item.description: A tropical low circling over south-eastern parts of the Northern Territory is continuing to bring damaging winds and heavy local rainfall in the Simpson and parts of the Barkly and Tanami areas.

item.title: Denmark and Greenland reject Trump's offer to send naval hospital ship
item.description: Denmark and its territory Greenland reject Donald Trump's offer to send a naval hospital ship to the Arctic island coveted by the US leader.

item.title: Neighbouring farmers say overwhelming fire risk from Lake Magenta Nature Reserve in WA's south-east
item.description: WA farmer Doug Giles has warned that parts of Lake Magenta Nature Reserve haven't been burned in 25 years, raising fears of a dangerous fire.

item.title: What worked for Milano Cortina may not work for Brisbane 2032, but this is the new Olympic norm
item.description: The 2026 Milano Cortina Winter Olympics Games was the first to follow a dispersed model. With Brisbane 2032 also set to have this set up, there are plenty of things to be aware of.

item.title: Man pleads not guilty over alleged home invasion shooting police say followed road rage incident
item.description: A 25-year-old man pleads not guilty to causing grievous bodily harm in the Hobart Magistrates Court, following an alleged home invasion shooting incident last month.

item.title: MAGA figure tells Australian conservatives Angela Merkel did more damage to Germany's fabric than Nazis
item.description: Benjamin Harnwell, the "international editor" of Steve Bannon's War Room podcast, says centre-right politicians have "betrayed" the West by supporting "mass immigration".

item.title: Wayne Klingberg avoids jail over crash that killed his employee in rollover near Hamley Bridge
item.description: A man has been spared jail time after his "substandard" driving resulted in a crash that caused the death of his passenger.

item.title: What experts want you to know about endometriosis, diagnosis and surgery as treatment
item.description: Allegations about endometriosis surgery have alarmed experts and distressed women living with the condition. Here's what to know about the chronic disease that affects about one in seven Australian women.

item.title: Portion of IS-linked Australians in Syria could resettle in NSW, premier says
item.description: Up to a third of Australian families of Islamic State fighters currently in a Syrian refugee camp could resettle in NSW if they eventually return to Australia, the state premier has said.

item.title: More details emerge after man shot dead by Secret Service at Mar-a-Lago
item.description: Austin Tucker Martin was seen at the Mar-a-Lago resort's north gate at about 1:30am on Sunday, local time. He has been described as being from a family of "big Trump supporters".

item.title: Ex-police officer Jonathan Andrew Beard cites 'cop's sixth sense' over allege knock and run assault
item.description: A former senior Sydney police officer accused of assaulting two men with a baseball bat who played a drunken game of knock and run at his house has told a court he "wasn't there to play" with home invaders.

item.title: Two men charged after man stabbed during confrontation in Kambalda
item.description: Two men are charged and another is flown to Perth with life-threatening stab wounds, after a weekend altercation in Kambalda.

item.title: Darcy Moore downplays Collingwood's injury woes, Patrick Dangerfield optimistic on Jeremy Cameron's health
item.description: Several of Collingwood's defensive stalwarts have suffered interrupted preseasons, but skipper Darcy Moore isn't concerned just yet.

item.title: Nine newspapers says printing The Age and The Australian Financial Review in Tasmania 'no longer sustainable'
item.description: Rising production costs and growing digital audiences are behind the company's decision to no longer print and distribute its newspapers, which includes The Age and The Financial Review, in Tasmania.

item.title: SA pastoralists receive more than 60mm of rain in 24 hours
item.description: South Australian pastoralists are preparing to buy livestock after the weekend's downpours brought more than 60 millimetres to some areas.

item.title: Cyber attack takes major chicken processor Hazeldenes offline leaving businesses without meat
item.description: A cyber attack at Hazeldenes chicken processing plant in central Victoria has stalled production and left butchers and pubs across the state without chicken.

item.title: Trump Tower deal set for Gold Coast as developer pushes against 'misconceptions'
item.description: Plans are afoot for a $1.5 billion, 91-storey Trump Tower in Surfers Paradise, which would be one of Australia's tallest towers if it goes ahead.

item.title: Canberra man jailed for 20 years for fatally stabbing his ex-wife in 2023
item.description: A 73-year-old man who fatally stabbed his former partner in their kitchen in 2023 has been sentenced in the ACT Supreme Court.

item.title: Death of Kelly T'Hart inspires shake up of WA driving laws
item.description: Tougher WA driving laws are expected to be introduced to parliament after a drunk driver, who was charged with killing a 32-year-old, was allowed to drive just two months after the incident.

item.title: Former UK PM Gordon Brown urges police to investigate if Andrew used RAF bases to meet Epstein
item.description: Former British prime minister Gordon Brown urges British police to investigate whether Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor used taxpayer-funded jets and Royal Air Force bases to meet with convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.

item.title: Reo Te Whetu Marama Marsh given life sentence for murdering Mary Benedito on Gold Coast
item.description: Reo Te Whetu Marama Marsh, who was then 34 years old, was charged In November 2021 over Mary Benedito's death after she was found unresponsive in a Southport apartment.

item.title: These four salads are tasty and substantial meals
item.description: If you’re after a healthy and summery dinner, these salads are a meal in a bowl and will tempt even the salad avoiders.

item.title: Teenager says he was verbally abused and punched in alleged antisemitic attack at scouts event in Victoria
item.description: A teenager says he was verbally abused and punched at a scouts event in regional Victoria for wearing a kippah and Israeli flag.

item.title: Richmond forward Mykelti Lefau suspended for two matches over drink driving charge
item.description: Mykelti Lefau is banned for two matches after a drink driving charge that will see him miss a pre-season clash as well as round one.

item.title: Road closures as heavy rain floods Alice Springs
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Kalgoorlie-Boulder Airport's potential $100m redevelopment on agenda as FIFO activity soars
item.description: A long-awaited feasibility study investigating the potential for a major expansion, estimated to cost up to $100 million, at one of Western Australia's busiest regional airports, is set to be delivered this week.

item.title: Muslim Australians fear rising Islamophobia as Ramadan begins
item.description: Muslim Australians fear Islamophobia is rising following comments made by One Nation leader Pauline Hanson and in the wake of recent threats against one of Australia's largest mosques.

item.title: Killing of Mexico's biggest drug lord 'El Mencho' sparks chaos among cartel members
item.description: Nemesio Oseguera Cervantes died after a gunfight with military personnel. Hours later, vehicles were set alight, roads blocked and shopfronts torched as retaliation in eight states.

item.title: UK government quietly updates passport rules for dual citizens — again
item.description: Travellers with both an expired UK passport, issued in 1989 or later, as well as a valid passport from a country that can issue an Electronic Travel Authorisation, may now be allowed to enter the UK.

item.title: Lesbian group takes fight to Federal Court in bid to exclude transgender women from events
item.description: A Victorian-based lesbian group is seeking an exemption to the Sex Discrimination Act so it can legally discriminate against transgender women when it holds public events.

item.title: Childcare chief executive not aware of number of breaches at centres, Brisbane senate inquiry told
item.description: The Affinity Education Group chief executive Glen Hurley told the Brisbane inquiry — which is examining the quality and safety of early childhood education and care systems — he would have to take the question on notice.

item.title: Bodycam footage shows tactical police officers using force on a handcuffed hit-and-run driver
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Police bodycam footage captures 'retributive' force used on St Edmund's College hit-and-run driver
item.description: Body-camera footage released by the ACT Supreme Court shows tactical police officers using force on a handcuffed hit-and-run driver outside St Edmund's College.

item.title: Monday Finance with Alan Kohler
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Toddler found unresponsive at Sydney day care may have died from a bacterial infection, inquest hears
item.description: A baby who died after being found unresponsive at a Sydney day care may have had a bacterial infection, an inquest has heard.

item.title: SA Police to scour mine shafts in renewed search for missing Andamooka woman Trisha Graf
item.description: Police will scour several mine shafts near the outback South Australian town of Andamooka in the latest search for missing mother Trisha Graf.

item.title: Arvind Ajay Singh extradited from Fiji to Sunshine Coast on rape charge
item.description: A Fijian national charged over the alleged rape of a child four years ago returns to Australia.

item.title: Tabatha Badger angling to replace outgoing Greens senator Peter Whish-Wilson
item.description: The ABC understands Tasmanian Greens MP Tabatha Badger is among the names vying to replace outgoing federal senator Peter Whish-Wilson.

item.title: The Lion King musical makes its return to Sydney
item.description: The Lion King musical makes its return to Sydney in April with the cast and crew opening its doors to rehearsals for a sneak peak.

item.title: Former youth worker Geoffrey Guest pleads not guilty to historical child sex abuse
item.description: Geoffrey John Guest is standing trial in Cairns after being charged with the abuse of a child in the 1970s.
